societies.name: St. Theresa of Child Jesus Society
societies.description: A society dedicated to following the 'Little Way' of St. Theresa, focusing on performing small acts with great love and devotion.

societies.name: Holy Family Akan Society
societies.description: A community that promotes family values and Akan cultural heritage in harmony with Catholic teachings.

societies.name: St. Cecilia Choir Society
societies.description: Dedicated to promoting sacred music and leading the congregation in worship through song and praise.

societies.name: Legion of Mary Society
societies.description: A society focused on Marian devotion and works of mercy in service to the Church and community.

societies.name: St. Vincent de Paul Society
societies.description: Committed to serving the poor and marginalized through charitable works and social justice initiatives.

societies.name: Divine Mercy Society
societies.description: Dedicated to spreading the message of Divine Mercy as revealed to St. Faustina, promoting God's endless mercy and compassion.

societies.name: Sacred Heart of Jesus Society
societies.description: Focused on devotion to the Sacred Heart of Jesus, promoting personal consecration and reparation through prayer and good works.

societies.name: Catholic Youth Association
societies.description: Engaging young Catholics in faith formation, leadership development, and community service while building lasting friendships.

societies.name: Catholic Women's League
societies.description: Empowering Catholic women through spiritual growth, leadership opportunities, and community service projects.

societies.name: Knights of St. John International
societies.description: A fraternal organization dedicated to charitable works, defending the faith, and supporting the Church through various initiatives.

societies.name: Knights and Ladies of the Altar
societies.description: A dedicated group of altar servers committed to serving at Mass and other liturgical celebrations with reverence and dignity. Members receive training in liturgical practices and grow in their understanding of the Mass.
